The wicked flee when no man pursueth: but the righteous are bold as a lion.<CM>

For the transgression of a land many <FI>are<Fi> the princes thereof: but by a man of understanding <FI>and<Fi> knowledge the state <FI>thereof<Fi> shall be prolonged.<RF>by…: or, by men of understanding and wisdom shall they likewise be prolonged<Rf><CM>
A poor man that oppresseth the poor <FI>is like<Fi> a sweeping rain which leaveth no food.<RF>which…: Heb. without food<Rf><CM>
They that forsake the law praise the wicked: but such as keep the law contend with them.<CM>
Evil men understand not judgment: but they that seek the LORD understand all <FI>things<Fi>.<CM>
Better <FI>is<Fi> the poor that walketh in his uprightness, than <FI>he that is<Fi> perverse <FI>in his<Fi> ways, though he <FI>be<Fi> rich.<CM>
Whoso keepeth the law <FI>is<Fi> a wise son: but he that is a companion of riotous <FI>men<Fi> shameth his father.<RF>is a companion…: or, feedeth gluttons<Rf><CM>
He that by usury and unjust gain increaseth his substance, he shall gather it for him that will pity the poor.<RF>unjust…: Heb. by increase<Rf><CM>
He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law, even his prayer <FI>shall be<Fi> abomination.<CM>
Whoso causeth the righteous to go astray in an evil way, he shall fall himself into his own pit: but the upright shall have good <FI>things<Fi> in possession.<CM>
The rich man <FI>is<Fi> wise in his own conceit; but the poor that hath understanding searcheth him out.<RF>own…: Heb. eyes<Rf><CM>
When righteous <FI>men<Fi> do rejoice, <FI>there is<Fi> great glory: but when the wicked rise, a man is hidden.<RF>hidden: or, sought for<Rf><CM>
He that covereth his sins shall not prosper: but whoso confesseth and forsaketh <FI>them<Fi> shall have mercy.<CM>
Happy <FI>is<Fi> the man that feareth alway: but he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into mischief.<CM>
<FI>As<Fi> a roaring lion, and a ranging bear; <FI>so is<Fi> a wicked ruler over the poor people.<CM>
The prince that wanteth understanding <FI>is<Fi> also a great oppressor: <FI>but<Fi> he that hateth covetousness shall prolong <FI>his<Fi> days.<CM>
A man that doeth violence to the blood of <FI>any<Fi> person shall flee to the pit; let no man stay him.<CM>
Whoso walketh uprightly shall be saved: but <FI>he that is<Fi> perverse <FI>in his<Fi> ways shall fall at once.<CM>
He that tilleth his land shall have plenty of bread: but he that followeth after vain <FI>persons<Fi> shall have poverty enough.<CM>
A faithful man shall abound with blessings: but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.<RF>innocent: or, unpunished<Rf><CM>
To have respect of persons <FI>is<Fi> not good: for for a piece of bread <FI>that<Fi> man will transgress.<CM>
He that hasteth to be rich <FI>hath<Fi> an evil eye, and considereth not that poverty shall come upon him.<RF>hasteth…: or, hath and evil eye hasteth to be rich<Rf><CM>
He that rebuketh a man afterwards shall find more favour than he that flattereth with the tongue.<CM>
Whoso robbeth his father or his mother, and saith, <FI>It is<Fi> no transgression; the same <FI>is<Fi> the companion of a destroyer.<RF>a destroyer: Heb. a man destroying<Rf><CM>
He that is of a proud heart stirreth up strife: but he that putteth his trust in the LORD shall be made fat.<CM>
He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool: but whoso walketh wisely, he shall be delivered.<CM>
He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack: but he that hideth his eyes shall have many a curse.<CM>
When the wicked rise, men hide themselves: but when they perish, the righteous increase.<CM>
